benchmark_details.name: ELAB (Extensive LLM Alignment Benchmark in Persian Language)
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a comprehensive evaluation framework for aligning Persian Large Language Models (LLMs) with critical ethical dimensions, including safety, fairness, and social norms by creating three types of Persian-language benchmarks: translated data, new synthetically generated data, and new naturally collected data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To develop a comprehensive framework for evaluating Persian LLMs, focusing on safety, fairness, and social norms.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Evaluations are constrained to open-source models with fewer than 10 billion parameters.

data.source: Translated and generated datasets from existing alignment benchmarks, along with explicitly collected data from social media.
data.annotation: Manual annotation by experts and evaluation using a GPT-based model.

methodology.calculation: Scores are derived from human evaluators rating LLM outputs on a scale based on safety, fairness, and social norms.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better alignment with safety, fairness, and social norms.
methodology.baseline_results: Performance across various alignment benchmarks as referenced in the paper.
methodology.validation: Uses a systematic evaluation approach involving multiple models and scoring systems.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Data includes demographic considerations specific to the Persian language context.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data collection was conducted with respect to user privacy and anonymity where feasible.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Attempts to align with local data protection regulations relevant to the Persian context.
